page.title: 08Pargetting
page.content: This is one of the traditional East Anglian building crafts. Timber framed buildings were covered in plaster between the beams of the frame. Designs were then made in the plaster. They were done by pressing a wooden mould into the wet plaster. The most common designs were simple geometric patterns. Designs in flowers were also done and more rarely elaborate figures as on the Sun Inn. Alec Clifton Taylor made a television programme for BBC about Saffron Walden in which he showed it being done.
